record.author: POLLEX 2000 (Bruce Biggs & Ross Clark)
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Central-Eastern Oceanic, Remote Oceanic, Central Pacific, East Fijian-Polynesian, Polynesian, Tongic

record.annotation: Think, consider, remember, wonder, try to understand; the mind, opinion (McE)
To bite off (as rind of sugarcane, etc)(Mce)
To cover (mainly refers to covering a shelter with leaves, or to cover an area of land with leaves (Sph)
Shrub, plant (McE) [this is likely a borrowed form, however the semantic value is different to the one needed here.
To plant; to conceive (of a woman) (McE)
Grow, spring up, be descended from (McE)
Wing of a bird, fin of a fish (McE)
Wing of a bird, fin of a fish (McE)
Wing of a bird or other flying creature (McE)
Light breeze (I), blow generally gentle breeze (McE)
Make fire, light fire, tend fire, cook (I)
To kindle, to light a fire
All, everyone, whole. Archaic, used in church (Sph)
And, with, for, nor, as, in, from (McE)
Twenty (only used in counting fish).(Source: Pollex)
